modules.description: This module handles path construction and retrieval for JavaScript and CSS resources, using string operations to combine and reference file paths, while also defining theme identifiers as constant strings for styling purposes. It supports use cases like generating URLs for static assets or applying theme-specific configurations in web-based applications. The functions emphasize structured string manipulation and predefined constants to manage resource locations and visual themes.

Generates and manipulates HTML elements for a slide presentation, including setting document title, linking CSS and JavaScript files, and creating slide structures. It constructs elements using a slide data type and applies configurations to render content dynamically. Functions support embedding themes, scripts, and custom attributes for interactive presentations.

Provides functions to configure and initialize a system with a specific configuration record. Works with a configuration type containing settings for global behavior. Used to set up default parameters before executing core application logic.

This module handles slide content generation and management, offering functions to create structured elements like titles, paragraphs, lists, and styled text, along with conversions for presentation settings such as transitions and colors. It operates on slide data structures, file paths, and configuration strings, enabling tasks like frame composition and property manipulation. Use cases include building dynamic presentations and customizing visual styles for different slide types.

Generates and manages HTML-based presentations with support for nested slides, Markdown content, and speaker notes using a declarative interface. Operates on structured data representing slide hierarchies, content blocks, and metadata. Enables creation of interactive, exportable presentations directly from OCaml code.

manages web-based presentation systems by combining path handling, HTML generation, configuration setup, and content structuring. It uses slide data types, configuration records, and string-based resource paths to build and customize presentations. Functions include generating HTML elements, applying themes, setting up global parameters, and creating structured slide content. Examples include constructing slide decks with dynamic styling, embedding scripts, and managing asset references for web delivery.
